intro: Phyllodoce empetriformis f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate mountain heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in whorls around the stems. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. This variety is distinguished by its intermediate morphological traits between the typical forms of Phyllodoce empetriformis.
